noun.description: A man who lives off a prostitute's earnings.

verb.description: Ask for or obtain (something to which one is not strictly entitled)
examples: I ponced a cigarette off her

proper noun.description: An industrial port in southern Puerto Rico, on the Caribbean Sea; population 144,500 (est. 2009).

phrases: NSW's great iconic pubs are all in the bush, the city ones having been long since ponced up.
I was expecting it to be all ponced up, but no, the Third World is staging a vigorous comeback.
I ponced around in front of the mirror

Billy is a Mike Tyson-shaped American who runs his class from a gym full of real people - quite unlike the odour-free folk poncing around in front of pastel gazebos that you see in the British videos.
So many people there were just poncing around in rubber outfits.
origin: Late 19th century: perhaps from the verb pounce.
